1-30-triangle.png.description: An isosceles right triangle, whose hypotenuse is the length of a radius. The two legs are labeled A and B.

blank-scatter-plot.png.description: An empty scatter plot with time on the x-axis and altitude on the y-axis
blank-scatter-plot.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap team, with contrived data

clock-6-equilateral.png.description: A circle with two radii extending out from the center, with a straight line connecting the two points on the circle where the radii land. The line is also the length of a radius

clock-6-hexagon.png.description: A circle with six radii extending out from the center, with straight lines connecting each pair of points on the circle where the radii land to create a hexagon

clock-graph-soln.png.description: Image from Desmos. A circle of radius 1 is drawn at the origin of a graph, with a radius rotating like the hands of a clock. On top of the circle, functions for sin and cos are plotted such that their period runs from 1 to 12

clock-graph.png.description: Image from Desmos. A circle of radius 1 is drawn at the origin of a graph, with a radius rotating like the hands of a clock.

convert-circle.png.description: A circle with 8 evenly-spaced blanks around it. Each blank has space to fill in the degrees and radians that represent that portion of the circle.

convert-circle-soln.png.description: A circle with 8 evenly-spaced blanks around it containing the degrees and radians that represent that portion of the circle.

egyptian-sundial.jpg.description: A picture of the oldest-known sundial. Dated 1500BC, the dial is drawn on a sheet of papyrus and divides the day into 12 sections.
egyptian-sundial.jpg.caption: The oldest-known sundial

Etymology.png.description: A line drawing of a bow and arrow. This drawing is repeated, superimposed on a circle so that the arrow represents the x-axis, with a radius drawn to the top of the bow. This radius, the arrow, and the portion of the bow between them forms a right triangle

ferris-wheel.png.description: A line drawing of a Ferris wheel, viewed from the side to show the circular wheel and the triangular base
ferris-wheel.png.license: Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Public Domain License

non-sinusoidal-graphs.png.description: Four graphs of periodic functions. The first is sinusoidal and the next three are jagged oscillations

pizza-slice2.png.description: A line-drawing of a pizza slice
pizza-slice2.png.license: No license specified. www.pngitem.com states 'PNG Images For Free Unlimited Download'

rides-combined-plot.png.description: A line graph with time on the x-axis and altitude on the y-axis. The dots appear to go up and down, over and over, as x increases.
rides-combined-plot.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap team, with contrived data

rides-scatter-plot.png.description: A scatter plot with time on the x-axis and altitude on the y-axis. The dots appear to go up and down, over and over, as x increases
rides-scatter-plot.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap team, with contrived data

state-fair.png.description: A silhouette of a state fair, showing the outline of a Ferris wheel, a roller coaster, and a tent
state-fair.png.license: Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Public Domain License

unit-circle-clock.png.description: A circle of radius 1, with two radii extending from the center to the circumference. The angle between the radii is marked as theta, and the intersections of the radii with the circumference are dotted. Outside the circle, the numbers 1-12 are written to resemble a clock
